FuncDef: The display igmp-snooping command displays all parameters of IGMP snooping running. These parameters include default and non-default parameters.
CLIs: display igmp-snooping { vlan <vlan-id> | vsi <vsi-name> | bridge-domain <bd-id> } [ configuration ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays IGMP snooping configurations in a specified VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Displays IGMP snooping configurations in a specified VSI.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays IGMP snooping configurations in a specified BD.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Display non-default IGMP snooping configurations in a specified VLAN/VSI/BD.
-

Examples: IGMP Version is Set to default 2
IGMP Query Interval is Set to default 60
IGMP Max Response Interval is Set to default 10
IGMP Robustness is Set to default 2
IGMP Last Member Query Interval is Set to default 1
IGMP Router Port Aging Interval is Set to 180s or holdtime in hello
IGMP Filter Group-Policy is Set to default : Permit All
IGMP Filter IP-Policy is Set to default : Permit All
IGMP Router Alert is Not Required
IGMP Proxy Router Protocol Action is Set to default: Termination All
IGMP Suppress Time is set to default 10 seconds
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To locate a fault that occurs during multicast service transmission, run the display igmp-snooping vsi command.
Prerequisites
IGMP snooping has been enabled globally and in the corresponding instance.
